title: Newton woman facing assault, kidnapping, other charges around alleged unlicensed cosmetic surgery in Allston
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Dingrui Wang, 34, of Newton faces charges for allegedly performing unlicensed cosmetic surgery causing permanent damage in Allston.
Wang is accused of practicing medicine without a license and lying about her qualifications to secure loans.
The victim, a 22-year-old woman, allegedly endured forced completion of surgery under duress after seeking to leave mid-procedure.

title: Car rammed by train in Abington after breaking down on tracks
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: A 2007 Honda broke down on train tracks and was hit by an MBTA train in Abington.
The incident occurred around 8 p.m. near Plymouth St.; the car was unoccupied at the time of the collision.
There were no casualties or injuries reported in the collision, according to Transit Police.

title: Woman, 57, walking in road due to snow hit and killed by car on Route 28 in Wareham, DA says
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: A 57-year-old woman was killed by a car on Route 28 in Wareham due to snow-covered sidewalks.
The woman and another pedestrian were first hit by a truck's mirror before the woman was struck by a Volvo.
The Volvo's driver was not speeding or distracted; an investigation into the incident is ongoing, authorities said.

title: Former North Shore police officer gets prison time for child porn charge
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Former Gloucester police officer Alexander Aiello sentenced to four years in prison for child pornography charge.
Aiello pleaded guilty to receiving child pornography in October 2025 after police found over 200 files on encrypted devices.
He was identified as a registered user of a site distributing child porn and used Tor Browser for anonymous access.

title: ‘The finest kind’: Gloucester mourns 7 lost in Lily Jean sinking as Coast Guard launches probe
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Seven people are presumed dead after the fishing boat Lily Jean sank off the coast of Gloucester, Massachusetts.
The U.S. Coast Guard and National Transportation Safety Board are investigating the cause of the Lily Jean's sinking.
Local officials and community members mourn the loss and describe the crew as dedicated and skilled fishermen.

title: Why readers think Bill Belichick belonged in the Hall of Fame this year
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Bill Belichick was not inducted as a first-ballot candidate for the Pro Football Hall of Fame's Class of 2026.
93% of over 450 Boston.com readers believe Belichick should have made the Hall of Fame this year.
Some readers cited his legacy of scandals while others stressed his successful coaching résumé for induction.

title: Which Patriots Super Bowl will you never forget?
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: New England Patriots prepare for their 12th Super Bowl appearance, recalling iconic moments from past games.
Historic plays include Adam Vinatieri’s 48-yard field goal in 2002 and Malcolm Butler's interception against the Seahawks.
Boston.com invites fans to share personal Patriots Super Bowl memories for potential feature articles.

title: This runner is raising awareness about stroke and heart disease
author: Kelly Chan
bullets: Liz Lang, 48, from Jackson, NJ, is running the 2026 Boston Marathon to raise awareness about stroke and heart disease.
Lang was diagnosed with heart arrhythmia in 2006 and antiphospholipid syndrome in 2025, pushing her to advocate for her health.
By joining Tedy’s Team, Lang aims to support research and community outreach on stroke and heart disease prevention.

title: Once a patient, now a runner: She’s running for Boston Children’s Hospital
author: Kelly Chan
bullets: Molly Kokoski, 26, will run the 130th Boston Marathon to raise funds for Boston Children's Hospital.
Kokoski, a Boston resident, was a patient at the hospital and lives with an ostomy bag due to ulcerative colitis.
She aims to demonstrate that living with an ostomy doesn't limit one's life and to give back to the hospital.

title: Saks OFF 5th to close Massachusetts stores
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Saks OFF 5th will close stores in Assembly Row and Wrentham as Saks Global files for bankruptcy.
Saks Global plans to focus on luxury retail, closing most Saks OFF 5th locations and all Last Call stores.
Saks Global secured $1.75 billion in financing to restructure debt after buying Neiman Marcus.
